intro: Oxypetalum brachystephanum, commonly known as the short-stephanum oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
